root: ^This is all the applicants that completed the dungeon?
^Much less than the last combat exam...

welcomespeech: ^Congratulations for completing the simulated dungeon and passing the combat exam.
^Sessions don't start until the next day, but you can spend your remaining time how you like.
^All rooms are opened, so I would recommend taking a look around and seeing what interests you.
^The training room is to your left, if you want to take a look there.
^Make sure to take this before you go in there.
^The dino gestures at the chest in front of him...

c-0: ^That little troublemaker, always providing applicants with information about exams.
^Thing is, the staff and I cannot seem to catch and stop him from doing so...
^He seems to be looking for you though.
^Told me to tell you to come to the training room if you pass and stuff.
^The training room is ahead of me.
^I don't know what you've talked about, but make sure you give him a little beating if he asks for a spar for me, will you?
c-1: ^A word from the creator of the game:
^I thought I made the game too hard, so I had to modify the difficulty many times!
^This is more of a prototype of a game if I were to be honest.
^If I had more time to work on the game I would change its entire foundation,
^as in the process of adding things on top of the current foundation I found a lot of limits to it,
^such as not being able to add abilities to the player that involved collisions, especially with enemies.
^Anyways, even though it's my first time I had a lot of fun creating the game.
^I've learned quite a bit about basic design like detecting collisions with objects and enemies,
^creating menus, and dialogue for npcs and players,
^thank you for playing my prototype of a game!
^Feel free to exit the game now.
